page.title: 16Kenn Village (page 2)
page.content: Along{Kenn Street}too, is a well maintained village hall where the usual village clubs and organisations meet e.g. W.I. meetings and Youth Club There are seven farms in{Kenn}- mostly dairy and beef farming. Some villagers are employed on the farms.{Stowell {Concrete Ltd.}employs {59}people and has been at{Kenn}since about{1964}. Back on{Clevedon Road,}you can see the flag pole which flies the Union Jack for both national and village celebrations. Here too is the village pub -{The Drum and Monkey}which, like other old buildings in the village has an ancient well.Next door is{Tripp {Robbins}garage, which is sometimes accused of not being "in keeping" with the village which competes annually for (and in{1982}won) the{Best Kept {Village Competition.}Kenn is friendly, welcoming and justifiably proud.
